SEARCH
Package musicSerialization

Klasse MusicCollectionManager

java.lang.Object
musicSerialization.MusicCollectionManager
public class MusicCollectionManager extends Object
Provides utility methods for reading and writing a MusicCollection to and from text files (semicolon-delimited) or binary serialized files.

  • Konstruktorübersicht

  • Konstruktordetails

    • MusicCollectionManager

      public MusicCollectionManager()

  • Methodendetails

    • read

      public static MusicCollection read(File artistsFile, File albumsFile, File songsFile) throws IOException
      Reads artists, albums, and songs from separate text files and populates a MusicCollection instance.

      Each file should contain one record per line in the format produced by the corresponding `toString` methods, delimited by semicolons.

      Parameter:
      artistsFile - the file containing serialized artists
      albumsFile - the file containing serialized albums
      songsFile - the file containing serialized songs
      Gibt zurück:
      a MusicCollection populated with the parsed data
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading any file

    • write

      public static void write(MusicCollection collection, File artistsFile, File albumsFile, File songsFile) throws IOException
      Writes the artists, albums, and songs from a MusicCollection to separate text files, one record per line using semicolon-delimited format.
      Parameter:
      collection - the MusicCollection to serialize
      artistsFile - the destination file for artists
      albumsFile - the destination file for albums
      songsFile - the destination file for songs
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing any file

    • binaryRead

      public static MusicCollection binaryRead(File artistsFile, File albumsFile, File songsFile) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Reads lists of artists, albums, and songs from separate binary files and populates a MusicCollection.
      Parameter:
      artistsFile - the file containing a serialized ArrayList<Artist>
      albumsFile - the file containing a serialized ArrayList<Album>
      songsFile - the file containing a serialized ArrayList<Song>
      Gibt zurück:
      a MusicCollection populated from the binary data
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading any file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found

    • binaryWrite

      public static void binaryWrite(MusicCollection collection, File artistsFile, File albumsFile, File songsFile) throws IOException
      Writes the lists of artists, albums, and songs from a MusicCollection to separate binary files.
      Parameter:
      collection - the MusicCollection to serialize
      artistsFile - the destination file for artists list
      albumsFile - the destination file for albums list
      songsFile - the destination file for songs list
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing any file

    • binaryReadSingleFile

      public static MusicCollection binaryReadSingleFile(File musicCollectionFile) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Reads an entire MusicCollection from a single binary file.
      Parameter:
      musicCollectionFile - the file containing a serialized MusicCollection
      Gibt zurück:
      the deserialized MusicCollection
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the MusicCollection class cannot be found

    • binaryWriteSingleFile

      public static void binaryWriteSingleFile(MusicCollection collection, File musicCollectionFile) throws IOException
      Writes the entire MusicCollection to a single binary file.
      Parameter:
      collection - the MusicCollection to serialize
      musicCollectionFile - the destination file for the serialized MusicCollection
      Löst aus:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
